briefTitle: Immunogenicity and Safety of the Concomitant Administration of a Tdap Vaccine and Meningococcal ACWY Conjugate Vaccine in Healthy Subjects Aged 11-25 Years
officialTitle: A Phase 3, Multi-Center, Observer Blind, Controlled, Randomized Study to Compare the Immunogenicity and Safety of the Concomitant Administration of a Combined Tetanus, Reduced Diphtheria, and Acellular Pertussis (Tdap) Vaccine and Chiron (Now Novartis) Meningococcal ACWY Conjugate Vaccine, With Either One Dose of Acellular Pertussis (Tdap) Vaccine, or One Dose of Chiron (Now Novartis) Meningococcal ACWY Conjugate Vaccine, in Healthy Subjects Aged 11-25 Years

interventions.name: Combined tetanus, reduced diphtheria and acellular pertussis vaccine (Tdap)

summary: Immunogenicity and Safety of the Concomitant Administration of a Tdap Vaccine and Meningococcal ACWY Conjugate Vaccine in Healthy Subjects Aged 11-25 Years

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With an Immune Response Against Diphtheria, Tetanus and Pertussis, When Tdap is Concomitantly Administered With MenACWY-CRM Compared to Tdap Given Concomitantly With Saline Placebo
